PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1941, pg. 16, reads: "Satchell [Satchel]Paige Tells His Public How He Does It - Satchell [sic] Paige, who first won fame as a pitcher in Pittsburgh, returned to the scenes of his early diamond exploits last week long enough to have a chat with some of his old friends at the Crawford Grill. Above, Satch' is shown talking to some of his followers and telling them how he struck out Joe DiMaggio three times and beat Dizzy Dean four out of five.  Satchell [sic] is slated to pitch in East-West game Sunday. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Satchel Paige, pitcher for the Kansas City Monarchs baseball team, seated at bar with Leonard "Big Bill" Williams on left, and other men, in Crawford Grill No. 1
